metadata.documentation: Transmitted through Unidata Internet Data Distribution.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 203 (J) Grid. National - Alaska (polar stereographic). Model runs are made at 0, 6, 12, and 18Z, with analysis and forecasts every 6 hours out 5 days. Horizontal = 45 by 39 points, resolution 190.5 km, Polar Stereographic projection. Vertical = 1000 to 100 hPa mandatory pressure levels (10 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 211 (Q) Grid. Regional - CONUS (Lambert Conformal). Model runs are made at 0, 6, 12, and 18Z, with analysis and forecasts every 6 hours out 10 days. Horizontal = 93 by 65 points, resolution 81.27 km, LambertConformal projection. Vertical = 1000 to 100 hPa pressure levels (29 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 213 (H) Grid. National - CONUS - Double Resolution (polar stereographic). Model runs are made at 0, 6, 12, and 18Z, with analysis and forecasts every 6 hours out 5 days. Horizontal = 129 by 85 points, resolution 95.25 km, Polar Stereographic projection. Vertical = 1000 to 100 hPa mandatory pressure levels (10 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 202 (I) Grid. National - CONUS (polar stereographic). Model runs are made at 0, 6, 12, and 18Z, with analysis and forecasts every 6 hours out 5 days. Horizontal = 65 by 43 points, resolution 190.5 km, Polar Stereographic projection. Vertical = 1000 to 100 hPa mandatory pressure levels (10 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 230 (G) Grid. Global Lat/Lon grid. Model runs are made at 0, 6, 12, and 18Z, with analysis and forecasts every 3 hours out to 84 hours. Horizontal= 361 by 720 points, resolution 0.5 degree, Lat/Lon projection. Vertical= 1000 to 100 hPa mandatory pressure levels (10 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.

variables.variable: Meridional Flux of Gravity Wave Stress @ surface
Water equivalent of accumulated snow depth @ surface
Zonal Flux of Gravity Wave Stress @ surface

metadata.documentation: NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 229 (F) Grid. Global Lat/Lon grid. Model runs are made at 0, 6, 12, and 18Z, with analysis and forecasts every 3 hours out to 180 hours. Horizontal = 181 by 360 points, resolution 1 degree, Lat/Lon projection. Vertical = 1000 to 100 hPa mandatory pressure levels (10 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 228 (A) Grid. Global Lat/Lon grid. Model runs are made at every 12 hours from 192 to 384 hours. Horizontal= 73 by 144 points, resolution 2.5 degree, Lat/Lon projection. Vertical = 1000 to 100 hPa mandatory pressure levels (10 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 204 (K) Grid. National-Hawaii. Model runs are made at 0Z, with analysis and forecasts every 12 hours out 10 days. Horizontal= 93 by 68 points, resolution 160 km, Polar Stereographic projection. Vertical = 1000 to 100 hPa mandatory pressure levels (10 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 201 (A) Grid. Northern Hemispheric (polar stereographic). Model runs are made at 0, 6, 12, and 18Z, with analysis and forecasts every 6 hours out 5 days. Horizontal = 65 by 65 points, resolution 381.0 km, Polar Stereographic projection. Vertical = 1000 to 100 hPa mandatory pressure levels (10 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.

NCEP GFS Model : AWIPS 205 (L) Grid. National - Puerto Rico (polar stereographic). Model runs are made at 0Z, with analysis and forecasts every 12 hours out 10 days. Horizontal = 45 by 39 points, resolution 190.5 km, Polar Stereographic projection. Vertical = 1000 to 100 hPa mandatory pressure levels (10 levels); surface, height above ground, pressure layers.
